cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a computational theory for learning-driven exploration by embodied agents, which involves identifying informative actions using Bayesian inference. This suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories. The paper also discusses how the proposed theory relates to information-theoretic objectives of behavior, such as predictive information and the free energy principle, which suggests a potential connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and systems and control (cs.SY) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions tasks such as navigation and reward gathering, which suggests a potential connection to computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category.
